alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Isle of Wight; James City; Newport News; Prince George; Surry; Sussex; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Charles City, northwestern Isle of Wight, central Prince George, central York, northeastern Sussex, southern James City, and Surry Counties, the northern City of Newport News and the City of Williamsburg through 515 PM EDT... At 429 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Rustic to near Carson. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Williamsburg, Waverly, Wakefield, Claremont, Surry, Disputanta, Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences, College Of William And Mary, Gloucester Point, Dendron, Busch Gardens, Rustic, Burrowsville, Carver Gardens, Elberon, Kings Point, Jamestown, Cabin Point and Scotland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for south central, eastern, southeastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Isle of Wight; James City; Newport News; Prince George; Surry; Sussex; York
